executive_summary.overview: Small-scale automotive manufacturing facilities require specialized equipment integration, strict adherence to automotive quality standards (IATF 16949, ISO 26262), and robust safety systems to ensure operational excellence and regulatory compliance.
key_findings: IATF 16949 quality management system mandatory for automotive suppliers
ISO 26262 functional safety standard governs safety-critical systems
ABB IRB and FANUC robots dominate small-scale assembly applications
Siemens and Allen-Bradley PLCs provide primary control architecture
Quality control requires precision CMM systems from Hexagon, ZEISS, Mitutoyo
recommendations: Implement redundant control systems with safety-integrated architecture
Deploy collaborative robots (cobots) for human-robot collaboration safety
Integrate real-time MES with quality management systems
Establish ASIL-compliant safety architecture for all equipment

receiving_area.description: Incoming parts inspection and staging area
receiving_area.safety_systems: Fire suppression, emergency lighting, personnel barriers

assembly_line.safety_systems: Collaborative robot safety systems, ASIL-rated safety controllers
